РОССИЯ ВПЕРЕД!!!

Россия — священная наша держава,
Россия — любимая наша страна.
Могучая воля, великая слава —
Твоё достоянье на все времена!

Славься, Отечество наше свободное,
Братских народов союз вековой,
Предками данная мудрость народная!
Славься, страна! Мы гордимся тобой!

От южных морей до полярного края
Раскинулись наши леса и поля.
Одна ты на свете! Одна ты такая —
Хранимая Богом родная земля!

Славься, Отечество наше свободное,
Братских народов союз вековой,
Предками данная мудрость народная!
Славься, страна! Мы гордимся тобой!

Широкий простор для мечты и для жизни
Грядущие нам открывают года.
Нам силу даёт наша верность Отчизне.
Так было, так есть и так будет всегда!

Начну с того, что в игре есть УЙМА недостатков. Начиная от багов, исправить которые уже можно было давно, заканчивая однообразием игровой составляющей и токсичными игроками. Но если отбросить это, то игра стоит того и ПОКА не имеет полноценных аналогов.

не играбельно для выживающих, всего 5 играбельных перков, убежать от мана можно если умеешь крутить 360 градусов. ну игра помойка, даже не качайте. Рекомендую обзор беса - бесполезный там вы все поймете. Хотя 10 тысяч игроков вам сам обо всем скажет. НЕ СОВЕТУЮ - ИГРА УЖАСНАЯ ПО ВСЕМ ФРОНТАМ!!!

There is a reason so many players with hundreds or thousands of hours are writing negative reviews of this game and would not recommend it. At its core, Dead by Daylight is an exciting experience, often being described as addicting, with players often being drawn in for weeks or months at a time. The high stakes, the skills needed for chases and escapes, the hard hits, the mind games, and the team dynamic for survivors undoubtedly helped launch this game from obscurity to a horror-genre mainstay back in 2016.

The game you would be getting if you bought it today is, at the best of times, still that game. 

But the game is almost never even close to great, let alone the best. You’ll likely spend dozens of hours chasing one or two “perfect” games that let you feel it was all worth it. The following issues have nothing to do with changes to any mechanics, perks, or the balance of the game made from 2016 to the present which could either hurt or help any one player based on their play style. 

The biggest single issue with the game is its player base. As a 4 vs. 1 game controlled by 5 different players the chances you get between 1 and 4 people who are not able to fulfill your expectations is quite high. The number of play styles for survivors and killers all but guarantees that someone will be trolling, doing memes, or otherwise playing in a way that makes you unhappy. It’s not that they’re playing wrong or that the game even has set play style rules. Its just that their play will make you feel less connected to the game, and that your actions, good or bad, are ultimately not relevant to the final outcome. Debates rage about camping the hook, gen rushing, killer taunting, flashlights, pallets, and on and on about what is or is not the “right” way to play. No matter how you play you will make someone else mad, and they’ll feel the same about you. Oh right, and that after game chat room will definitely have someone telling you to kill yourself before the end of your first few games.

This leads to the game’s next major issue and why so many long time players are finally turning away. The developers of the game seem to encourage or even incite negative, threatening behavior among their players both in the game and on social media. Why are people who have seemingly been hand selected by the dev team able to get away with calling someone else pejorative names or encouraging them to commit suicide in public, on social media? Any hope that the toxic, exceedingly negative behavior by players would ultimately be cleaned out of the game after years of community requests has become nothing more than hopes and dreams, empty promises never fulfilled by a company which claims it’s doing a pretty good job of managing things.

Which brings about the third issue that has so many people leaving the game. The developers do not actively listen to community feedback or try to build a game based on what people want. Admittedly what “people want” is highly subjective, and it is hard to quantify in a game like Dead by Daylight. There are a few obvious things that all (sane) gamers want however. Wouldn’t it be nice if there was an update or hot fix for an issue and it did not break something else. This is everything from Easy Anti Cheat to any mechanic, sound, cosmetic, or even the menus in the game. How about lobbies that have consistent wait times, and match you with players of your own rank. Most players want a ranking system that rewards you for being good, not just playing more, which often is not the case in this game. The list goes on, the years of feedback are out there, and almost none of the rational things to improve quality of life in this game have ever been implemented correctly, if at all.

Staying with the idea that the game is a buggy mess in 2020 highlights a key thing that remains unchanged from its original launch. At this point, however, the things that break are so far disconnected from the things being fixed that it seems almost as if the developers break them on purpose. Are they purposefully keeping people aggravated, hitting up social media to complain about a broken mechanic, only serving to generate a hyped up, word of mouth marketing program that runs 24/7. When you watch their developer streams the complete lack of respect they have for the community when they address issues is a good indication that yes, it is exactly what they are thinking.

For people who have played the game for a long time, the condescending attitude about game-breaking issues or messed up mechanics feels even worse when the company is pumping out so many cosmetics and paid DLC every month. The developers know people will buy their product no matter how broken it is. The issue isn’t that the company wants to make money, but that it does not address major issues that undermine the very existence of their micro-transactions or DLC. What good does a new Claudette skin do anyone if they cannot play? There have been times no one can reliably play the game for days on end, but the company announces a new skin set or DLC while promising to look into the technical issue ASAP. 

Finally, if you’re a new player its worth noting that some players will find it easy to get lobbies right away as a killer or survivor. Others only have access to one or the other, or the server they get is always so slow its hard to play the game properly. Time of day can have a huge impact, so if you can only play at night it might be an issue. With all of the bugs, the restarts, the games where someone disconnects, and every other obstacle to you actually being in a match, the amount of time you spend genuinely playing the game is probably going to be a lot lower than you think even if you’re someone who gets lobbies quickly.

Which comes back to the entire point of this review. Once you do get a lobby - ideally full of survivors you know as a Survive with Friends, or on a very, very lucky day 4 competent players - you still have to be paired with a killer who engages in what you believe to be fair play.  On the killer side you have to have 4 people who don’t make you want to rage quit for whatever reason. No matter how you like playing DbD the bottom line is all five people have to play in a way YOU feel is fun, or else it’s just another bad game while you wait for the one the really hits your addictive need for a good match. 

The fact everyone must play your way for you to enjoy it is why this game is not recommended. There are just too many moving parts where things can go wrong that you’re more likely to feel frustrated every match than satisfied. Slowly your anger will rise and you’ll find yourself becoming one of the angry, toxic crowd that you started out promising you’d never be. Because YOUR needs every game will not be met by this game that must simultaneously meet the needs or 4 others as well. What started as a fun horror game will become a toxic, stress filled addiction that can never be fulfilled. Those 10 USD cosmetics will sooth your feelings for a bit, only to have them come back stronger, more angry, and darker than ever before.

Save yourself a bunch of headaches, stress, and unfulfilled gaming hours waiting for those perfect 10 minutes an ideal match can give you. Don’t feed money to developers who fail to stop hatred and bullying and don't bother getting yourself addicted to a broken video game. There was a time this game was fun and I couldn't put it down. Slowly but surely it's become a toxic mess where nothing works the way it should and that's exactly why you're seeing so many negative reviews from long term players.
